meanings.definition: Bring (a task or activity) to an end.
meanings.sent1: Let's finish our homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: I always finish my chores before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: I tried to finish eating all the cookies, but there were too many!
meanings.sent4: She sprinted to the finish line of the race.
meanings.sent5: The students cheered as they watched the finish of the school play.

meanings.definition: Reach the end of a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: The runners will finish the marathon in the afternoon.
meanings.sent2: Who do you think will finish first in the swimming competition?
meanings.sent3: The tortoise was determined to finish the race against the hare.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of accomplishment as she crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The car race was thrilling to watch as the drivers raced to the finish.

meanings.definition: The surface appearance of a manufactured material or object.
meanings.sent1: The table had a shiny finish that sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The painter applied a smooth finish to the walls of the room.
meanings.sent3: The finish on the car made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The wood had a glossy finish that enhanced its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The finish on the sculpture gave it a polished and elegant look.
